newsitem.title: USA: GPU sees 850 MW Pa. coal unit up Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: GPU sees 850 MW Pa. coal unit up Wednesday.

text.p: GPU Generation Inc expected the 850 megawatt (MW) Conemaugh 2 coal-fired generation unit back in service Wednesday after being shut Sunday to repair a boiler tube leak, the company said Tuesday.
The return of the unit depends on results of startup tests later today, a GPU spokeswoman said.

"It will be hydrotested by the midnight crew," she said, explaining water will be pressured into the unit to detect any The adjoining Conemaugh unit 1, also at 850 MW, was shut Sept 5 for seasonal maintenance, and was scheduled to resume operation in October.
The Conemaugh facility, in Indiana County in western Pennsylvania, is jointly owned by utility members of the Pennsylvania-New Jersey-Maryland Interconnect power pool.
Both Conemaugh units are operated by GPU Generation, a subsidiary of General Public Utilities Corp of Parisippany, N.J.
